actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on June 21, 2024.

The Chair informed the House that, pursuant to House Resolutions 1292 and 1293, the Speaker has certified to the United States Attorney for the District of Columbia the refusal of Merrick B. Garland to produce documents, records, and materials to the Committees on the Judiciary and Oversight and Accountability as directed by subpoena.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on June 17, 2024, at 3:30 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 3984, S. 4548, and H.R. 4581.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Larry Bucshon to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
